args:
The prince and his fellow fugitives have a run-in
with a brash young sylvan named Luca whose
village is under attack from the Empire. They
team up and hurry to the village to intervene.

{player_name} and his companions have
become fugitives from the Royal Guard.
Several days pass as they are harried by
soldiers and fiends alike...
You look bad, {player_name}.\nYou wanna rest for a bit?
Yeah, cheer up! I mean, sure, the\nkingdom's turned into an evil empire and\nour lives have all basically been ruined...
But whenever I feel low, I look up at the\nclouds 'n' remember I don't have to be\nblue... That's the sky's job!
I think you need to dig a little deeper\nfor words of inspiration.
Aw, come on! That was great!
Don't worry, everyone. I'm fine.\nI just wish we had some sort of plan.
They've found us, and they got an archer!\nEveryone, down!
If you're smart, you won't move a muscle,\nbecause I never miss.
Look at those ears... He's a sylvan!
And he looks seriously hurt, too!
I think it's safe to assume a sylvan would\nnever do Harle's bidding.
Easy, friend. You look like you're\nabout to fall over there.
Nngh... You imperial vermin did this!\nYou and your dragons!
I'd never have lost to them if they'd\nfought fair!
I'd still have my little sister, and you\nwouldn't see...a scratch on me...
He's out cold. What's our play here,\n{player_name}?
We can't just leave him here; I need to\nknow what he meant by ＂dragons.＂\nCan someone heal him?
I know a bit of the restorative arts,\neven if my power pales next to Zethia's.
We've healed your wounds,\nbut you should keep still.
You're...those people from before.\nWhy did you help me?
What'd they do to ya, anyway?\nYou look like nine kinds'a hell.
They attacked us for no reason.
We were just going about our lives,\nwhen— *cough* Argh...
Sit still, or else I shall cast tranquilizing\nmagic on you. It's for your own good.
Tell us everything that happened.\nBegin with your name.
I'm Luca. My village and the kingdom\nhave always left each other be.
I heard about all the political shake-up\nbut assumed things would stay the same.
Until that snake came along with his\ndragon and ordered us to bend the knee\nto the emperor.
He said he was some prince—\nsixth in line for the throne.
We refused, of course, at which point he\nthreatened to destroy the village. So I\nlunged at him, and...and I was winning!
No, you weren't. Only a fool would\nchallenge a dragon.
You lost and washed up by the side of\nthe lake.
What? No! I fought valiantly!\n...Er, by my reckoning.
Well, sounds like ya had a rough time.\nBut now it all makes sense.
When we bumped into Emile and his army,\nthey musta been comin' here to invade\nyer village.
Then the Dyrenell Empire has returned in\nmore than name, for they were merciless\ncurs who tortured man and dragon alike.
The demon worshippers struck fear in all\nwho crossed their path. Why would the\nking resurrect such a detested name?
Uh, to scare people, probably.\nAnd I'd say it's workin'!
No better way to get folks to toe the\nline than sayin', ＂Hey, remember those\nguys what slaughtered half the world?＂
That's why they want to destroy your\nvillage. They want to make an example.
I don't care what their reason is.\nThey'll pay for all of this.
I can't stay here a moment longer.\nI need to help my people.
Luca, you won't be any help to your\npeople if you're dead. Let us go with you.
And put you face-to-face with that dragon?\nI don't think so.
I don't want you on my conscience, too.
Emile is using his dragon to torture\ninnocent people. That affects all of us.
But we can stop him together.
And more to the point, I'm sick and tired\nof running away.
I need to confront him and find out who\nhas taken my father's place on the throne.
I'm {player_name}. Emile's\nyounger brother, and seventh in line\nfor the throne.
Holy pine nuts! You're the traitor they're\nall looking for!
Don't believe a word those spiders say.
Oh, I don't. Now that I've gotten a closer\nlook at you, I can see in your eyes that\nyou're all honest folk.
Now follow me, everyone.\nWe have a dragon to confront!
Wait. You're going to trust us,\njust like that?
Ha ha! The elder said it best.\n＂When the wicked brand traitors,\nthat's when you know who to trust.＂
The enemy of my enemy is my friend.\nNow, are we a team or what?
We are, Luca. And thank you.\nNow let's get to your village!
